text: Shosanbetsu village wooden torii is a village located in Rumoi Subprefecture, Hokkaido, Japan. As of September 2016, the village has an estimated population of 1,249 and a density of 4.5 persons per km². The total area is 280.04 km². Shosanbetsu observatory is a planetarium-cum-astronomical observatory which is a popular attraction in this region. Shosanbetsu was the hometown of famed bear hunter Yamamoto Heikichi, famous for his killing of the bear Kesagake. ==External links== * *Official Website Category:Villages in Hokkaido
title: Shosanbetsu, Hokkaido
